page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT.
page.content: We interviewed as many people as we could in our D-block and a few Easthorpe children to find out what their parents do for a living. We were quite surprised by the range of occupations which were as follows: Game keeper,nursery worker,social worker,camp equipment dealer,insurance broker,quality engineering manager, teacher and British Telecom Engineer. One person was self-employed and two were pensioners.There was also an army officer,brick layer,factory workers,cafe assistant,children's nurse,electrician,farmer,civil servant and a printer.There was also a worker in the bacon trade and one man was a pilot flying Jumbo jets. The range of the distance people have to travel to work is between 2 and 60 miles.
